word.entryDescription: the day after Friday
word.entryExample: I don't go to school on Saturday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a food made of very small pieces of meat inside a skin (=a thin long bag)
word.entryExample: Can I have a sausage for breakfast, please?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to express something in words
word.entryExample: Say "good morning".
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: frightened or worried
word.entryExample: The room was dark and the boy was very scared.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long item of clothing you wear around the neck
word.entryExample: I want to buy my mum a scarf for her birthday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something that is scary makes you feel afraid
word.entryExample: This movie is scary!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a child's vehicle with a tall handle and two wheels joined to a board. You stand on the board with one foot and push with the other foot to move forward.
word.entryExample: My little sister can ride a scooter.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large area of open salty water
word.entryExample: I love swimming in the sea.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place near the sea where people go for fun
word.entryExample: We went to the seaside at the wieekend.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number two when we count
word.entryExample: Who was second in the race?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to sense something with your eyes
word.entryExample: What kind of a film would you like to see this evening?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to make a letter, message, object, information, etc go from one place to another
word.entryExample: Will you send me a text when you get on the train?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 7
word.entryExample: I'm seven years old.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 17
word.entryExample: My sister is seventeen.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number seven when we count
word.entryExample: Sunday is the seventh day of the week.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: We use shall to ask for suggestions
word.entryExample: Shall I help you with this exercise?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large sea fish that usually has very sharp teeth and a triangular fin on its back
word.entryExample: Are there any sharks in the water?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a farm animal that people keep for its thick wool and meat
word.entryExample: Sheep live on a farm.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small hard object you find on a beach
word.entryExample: There are some beautiful shells on the beach.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large sea boat
word.entryExample: My father works on a ship and he travels all over the world.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of the hard things you wear on your feet especially when you are outside
word.entryExample: Whose shoes are these?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place where you can buy something
word.entryExample: There are lots of shops on the high street.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a strong bag with handles for carrying a shopper's purchases
word.entryExample: Take a shopping bag with you.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a list of items to be purchased
word.entryExample: Write a shopping list before you go out.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a short person or thing is smaller in height than other people or things
word.entryExample: I'm short but my sister is tall.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: trousers which do not cover the lower part of your legs
word.entryExample: I don't have nice shorts for summer.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of your body where your arm joins your chest
word.entryExample: I carry my bag over my shoulder.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to say something with a loud voice or cry
word.entryExample: The pirate shouted, 'There's the treasure!'
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to let something be seen
word.entryExample: Can you show me the pictures from your last holiday?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of equipment that produces a flow of water you stand under to wash yourself
word.entryExample: I have a shower after I get up every morning.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing with a name or information outside a house, shop, etc
word.entryExample: There's a large sign above the door.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not sensible, acting like a child
word.entryExample: Sam sometimes is very silly!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to make music with your voice, usually with words
word.entryExample: I love to sing pop songs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who sings, usually as a job
word.entryExample: This singer is the best in the band.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a woman or girl who has the same parents as you
word.entryExample: My sister Anna is ten years old.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move your body into a sitting position
word.entryExample: Sit down and read your book.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 6
word.entryExample: My aunt has six children.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the number 16
word.entryExample: We live sixteen kilometres away from the sea.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in the position of number six when we count
word.entryExample: June is the sixth month.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move on special boots across ice or hard flat surfaces
word.entryExample: Can you skate well?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of a pair of boots with a blade or wheel on the bottom which you use to skate with
word.entryExample: Do you have any skates?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a short board with a pair of wheels at each end, which you stand on and ride
word.entryExample: Don't ride your skateboard at home!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: somebody who skates on ice
word.entryExample: She's my favourite skater.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an area of ice used for ice skating
word.entryExample: I move on the skating rink very slowly.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to turn a rope and jump over it many times
word.entryExample: I can skip very fast.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of clothing that a girl or woman wears on the lower half of the body
word.entryExample: She's wearing a lovely skirt!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the space above the earth's surface in which you can see clouds, stars, the sun, etc
word.entryExample: The sky is blue and the sun is shining.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very tall building
word.entryExample: There are lots of skyscrapers in Times Square.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to be in an unconscious state when your body and mind are resting, and your eyes are closed
word.entryExample: The cat likes to sleep in my bedroom.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not moving fast
word.entryExample: This train is really slow.
word.label: ydp
